{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561962,"name":"","username":"carpe_diem","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/fbc32d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T17:45:34.915Z","cooked":"

I’ve had some experience with TIG in the past, but have mostly forgotten everything now. I’ve been wanting to relearn how to TIG weld but my school doesn’t have a metal shop (in fact, I don’t think any school in the district has the necessary equipment). It doesn’t appear that the local community college has anything either.

Classes near me cost about $500 a pop, which I think is ridiculous. Am I wrong? Does anyone have suggestions for going about learning to weld?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-19T17:45:34.915Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":350,"readers_count":349,"score":140.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496233,"topic_slug":"learning-to-tig-weld-solo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73781,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/learning-to-tig-weld-solo/496233/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3562352,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T21:55:28.551Z","cooked":"

You could buy a cheap TIG welder

If you’ve done it before then re-learning will likely go pretty well.
Start with make a pool and move it. Work up to adding metal. Then think about actually connecting things.
Steel or stainless steel is what I would practice on.

You might see if there’s someone near you with a machine. I’m in Houston, which probably won’t help you much in Fremont…

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-19T21:55:28.551Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":308,"readers_count":307,"score":81.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496233,"topic_slug":"learning-to-tig-weld-solo","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/learning-to-tig-weld-solo/496233/2","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3562550,"name":"J.s","username":"JaySlinky","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/aca169/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T02:04:41.447Z","cooked":"

You could check to see if there are any maker spaces near you or if you’re a high school student, see if there are any career tech centers you can enroll in, they’re free and how I learned to weld. If you can’t find any places near you then I would probably invest in a decent tig welder and start learning on steel. I started by making a puddle and creating a little stringer across the plate by making circular motions, then once i got a hang on that I started adding filler metal. Steve Bleile on youtube is a good resource for learning.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T02:04:41.447Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":249,"readers_count":248,"score":64.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496233,"topic_slug":"learning-to-tig-weld-solo","display_username":"J.s","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63615,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/learning-to-tig-weld-solo/496233/3","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3562595,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T02:59:33.878Z","cooked":"

By the time you get all equipped, even with a “Harbor Freight” welder, it’s going to be more than $500, though.

Save up, get a used welder, and start welding. You might not stacking dime right away but you’ll get much better with practice.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T06:05:56.368Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":164,"readers_count":163,"score":52.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496233,"topic_slug":"learning-to-tig-weld-solo","display_username":"Ardiano Works","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57747,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/learning-to-tig-weld-solo/496233/5","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3562714,"name":"Tristan Lall","username":"Tristan_Lall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tristan_lall/{size}/97_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T07:17:01.905Z","cooked":"
MSU2000:

get a used welder

Newer welders are so much more capable than even 10 years ago. They’re smaller, multi-voltage capable, and the better ones have high-frequency arc start, adjustable frequency, adjustable slope, adjustable balance and timed pulses.

Once you have a recipe you like, featuring these controls, your efforts will be more reliable and therefore rewarding. (You’re not learning to weld in austere conditions as a hobbyist, so relying on having a machine with advanced features is not a detriment.)

carpe_diem:

Classes near me cost about $500 a pop, which I think is ridiculous. Am I wrong?

How many hours of class + practice time is that? If it is weekly for a whole semester, that seems reasonable.

I totally agree! My vintage Synchrowave is big enough to hide multiple bodies in… It was -given- to me when my favorite welding shop was modernizing their welders. A 300 Amp modern welder is only -55- pounds and does far more than mine! And, FYI, 300 Amps is waaaay more than you need for anything other than HEAVY duty fabrication!

For real “OMG” in the welding world, Fronius has -battery- powered welding machines you can WEAR on a frickin’ ladder! And its a real welder, not some “needs super special tiny welding rods”

From what I saw, this is per one three hour class.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T15:53:07.565Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":20.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496233,"topic_slug":"learning-to-tig-weld-solo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":235,"username":"Tristan_Lall","name":"Tristan Lall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tristan_lall/{size}/97_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73781,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/learning-to-tig-weld-solo/496233/8","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3568336,"name":"Ardiano Works","username":"MSU2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msu2000/{size}/190139_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T19:07:54.014Z","cooked":"

Newer welders are so much more capable than even 10 years ago. They’re smaller, multi-voltage capable, and the better ones have high-frequency arc start, adjustable frequency, adjustable slope, adjustable balance and timed pulses.

I have this exact one. For newbie, this is a bit overkill to get a new one. Brand new setup with Bottle would run you about $1300. A used one like this is hard to find (people like this welder for a great reason). However, a used Harbor Freight Titanium Tig or similar with 80 lbs Ar Tank is about $700 in my area.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T19:11:00.779Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":80,"readers_count":79,"score":36.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496233,"topic_slug":"learning-to-tig-weld-solo","display_username":"Ardiano Works","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://primeweld.com/products/tig-225x-ac-dc-tig-welder","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":11}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":235,"username":"Tristan_Lall","name":"Tristan Lall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tristan_lall/{size}/97_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57747,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/learning-to-tig-weld-solo/496233/9","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3568439,"name":"Tristan Lall","username":"Tristan_Lall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tristan_lall/{size}/97_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T20:44:50.690Z","cooked":"
MSU2000:

I have this exact one. For newbie, this is a bit overkill to get a new one.

Yes, definitely overkill—but for someone who is feeling pretty committed and has the resources, I don’t think it has any pitfalls that would force someone to unlearn anything as they gain experience. Some of the cheaper welders do have some compromises.

For the Harbor Freight ones, the orange (Vulcan) series is pretty good, but get the real TIG not the multiprocess welder, unless you want to deal with weird non-standard connectors. I haven’t had a close look at the green (Titanium) ones, but they seem to be a reasonable budget option.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T20:44:50.690Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":61,"readers_count":60,"score":27.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496233,"topic_slug":"learning-to-tig-weld-solo","display_username":"Tristan Lall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/learning-to-tig-weld-solo/496233/10","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3571495,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T18:59:07.670Z","cooked":"

Northern Tool has gas bottles on the shelf. You have to buy the bottle to start with ($200-300) and then you just swap it to refill for about $50.
Don’t get a full size bottle unless you are welding professionally. Honestly, the #1 reason I have to refill is when I forget to close the dratted valve… Despite the big red indicator…
You totally want one of these to remind you to turn it off (make sure you get the right number of lobes on the handle). Soooooo worth the $12!
https://www.trick-tools.com/GVC300-Strong-Hand-EZ-View-Gas-Cylinder-Valve-Indicator-17258

plan","slug":"looking-for-feedback-on-training-plan","posts_count":5,"reply_count":2,"highest_post_number":5,"image_url":null,"created_at":"2024-08-10T08:03:43.031Z","last_posted_at":"2024-09-01T06:53:29.532Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2024-09-01T06:53:29.532Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"Hey
